item.title: How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The Milwaukee Brewers return for this MLB season looking to build on last year’s National League Central triumph. Fortunately, you can watch all Brewers games live with the right channels in your TV roster.

The post How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Looking to watch the Milwaukee Brewers today? Fortunately, you can catch all Brewers games live with the right channels and TV setup.

The Brew Crew is rolling through the 2025 MLB season with a ton of momentum, proving last year’s National League Central triumph was no fluke. With head coach Pat Murphy at the helm, the team is embracing a new era—navigating through changes while keeping its World Series dreams alive.

Although MLB was going to take over broadcasting the Brewers’ in-market games, the team ultimately struck a deal to keep local matchups on FanDuel Sports Wisconsin (formerly Bally Sports Wisconsin). That means many TV details remain unchanged from last season. But keep reading, as I outline this season’s viewing specifics—including the complete TV schedule and free viewing options.

Jump to:

  • Milwaukee Brewers channels
  • Milwaukee Brewers TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Brewers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Milwaukee Brewers games?

You can watch in-market Milwaukee Brewers games on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin (FDSWI), with select simulcasts airing on over-the-air affiliates throughout Wisconsin. Nationally televised games will appear on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, while some will stream on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live outside the FanDuel Sports Wisconsin broadcast region, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS for out-of-market viewing.

Want radio coverage? Fans can stream home and away radio broadcasts of every Brewers game on MLB At Bat. Games also air on AM and FM stations within the Brewers Radio Network, featuring announcers Jeff Levering, Lane Grindle, and Josh Maurer.

Score the best Milwaukee Brewers TV plan

Enter your zip code below to see top TV and internet providers in your area.

2025 Milwaukee Brewers playoffs TV schedule

The Brewers began the 2025 MLB season with an Opening Day loss against the New York Yankees. In fact, they lost that entire opening series. But you wouldn’t know it now, as Milwaukee rolled into October with the spot in the National League Division Series.

Starting Saturday, October 4, the Brewers will start their journey toward a World Series against the Chicago Cubs, who beat the San Diego Padres in the Wild Card series.

The full schedule is below as we know it right now. I’ll update it as more info becomes available.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers for free

Get Free Local Channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase†)
Milwaukee Brewers channels:
ABC and FOX
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

†CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch select Milwaukee Brewers games for free on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, which requires no TV subscription. To identify channels in your area, enter your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool. Then, explore our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations, including the mid-range Mohu Leaf 50.

Free MLB games also stream daily on MLB.TV. All you need is an MLB.com account to tune in, but blackout restrictions apply for in-market fans.

Another way to watch free games is through a live TV streaming trial. DIRECTV STREAM offers a free five-day trial with core MLB channels and RSNs, including FanDuel Sports Wisconsin. Other free trials are regularly available through Fubo and YouTube TV.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers FAQ

Can I watch the Brewers game on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Brewers fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video through the MLB.TV Prime Video Channels add-on. In-market coverage is also available on Prime Video with the FanDuel Sports Network add-on.

Have the Brewers returned to FanDuel Sports Network?

Yes, Brewers games will remain on FanDuel Sports Network (formerly Bally Sports) for the 2025 MLB season. In December 2024, the Brewers announced that they reached an agreement for FanDuel Sports Network to produce and distribute the team’s telecasts for another year.

How can I watch the Brewers on Spectrum?

Spectrum TV customers can watch nationally televised Brewers games on ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. In-market fans can get FanDuel Sports Wisconsin with the TV Select Plus plan, while MLB EXTRA INNINGS is available for out-of-market fans.

Does YouTube TV carry Brewers games?

Yes, YouTube TV carries select Brewers games that air nationally. But the live TV streaming service doesn’t offer FanDuel Sports Wisconsin, MLB Network, or MLB.TV access.

How can I stream the Brewers?

You can stream Milwaukee Brewers games on any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Sling TV is an inexpensive option, but I recommend DIRECTV STREAM for better in-market coverage. You can also stream in-market games on FanDuel Sports Network and out-of-market coverage on MLB.TV.

Why you should trust us

As a Wisconsin native and lifelong Brewers fan, our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, knows exactly what it takes to follow the Brew Crew. For this guide, he combined that fan passion with expert analysis, cross-referencing the full 2025 schedule with the channel lineups and pricing of every major TV provider to find the best deals for Brewers fans.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every Los Angeles Dodgers game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide—featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post The Ultimate Guide To Watching the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Just one year removed from winning the World Series, the Los Angeles Dodgers have to try a little harder if they want to get back there.

The Dodgers beat the Cincinnati Reds in the National League Wild Card Series. Now they’re set to play the Philadelphia Phillies in the Division Series, but will have to start with two games on the road. The Dodgers were the only team to sweep their Wild Card series.

To keep up with all the action, keep reading this complete watch guide.

  • Watch the Dodgers for free

2025 Los Angeles Dodgers playoffs TV schedule

The schedule shifts to the City of Brotherly Love for the Dodgers starting on Saturday, October 4. The best-of-five series will be a difficult one for L.A., but we’re also talking about the defending champions.

Which channels have Los Angeles Dodgers games?

You can catch every 2025 Dodgers games on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, SportsNet LA, and Apple TV+.

If you don’t live in or near the City of Angels, you won’t get access to the regional sports network SportsNet LA. So, if you live somewhere like Baltimore and want to keep up with Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto among The Boys In Blue, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games broadcasted on this RSN.

Dodgers fans will want ESPN for the final year of Sunday Night Baseball games, and you might also consider signing up for Apple TV+ to stream some Friday Night Baseball games.

Need quicker internet to support streaming live MLB games?

No Dodgers fan wants their stream to lag in the middle of a tied ninth inning. Enter your zip code below to find the best internet providers near you.

How can I watch the Dodgers Spring Training games?

SportNet LA will broadcast most, if not all, of the LA Dodgers’ 2025 Spring Training matchups. If you strike out on this RSN, you might be able to watch some on MLB Network or stream them on ESPN+. We’ll update the Spring Training TV schedule below as more info comes out.

Don’t forget: Toward the end of Spring Training, the Dodgers and Chicago Cubs will kick off the 2025 MLB regular season early on March 18 and 19. The two-game series will take place in Tokyo, Japan, and air on FOX Sports channels.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch Toronto Blue Jays baseball on TV with our guide, featuring game times, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In professional sports, few things are more frustrating than unfulfilled potential, and Toronto Blue Jays fans have felt that sting more than once in recent years. Despite a talented core and multiple playoff appearances from 2015 to 2023, the team never managed to make a deep postseason run. Big expectations often turned into big letdowns.

Then came 2025, and the Blue Jays turned out to be one of the best teams in the Show.

Toronto won 94 games and earned a spot in the American League Championship Series. The Blue Jays will play the Seattle Mariners starting Sunday, October 12.

If you’re a Toronto fan who’s been itching to see if the Blue Jays can make a deep playoff run this year, I’ll show you how you can catch every playoff game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Blue Jays channels
  • Toronto Blue Jays TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Blue Jays TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Blue Jays games?

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., Toronto Blue Jays games are available out-of-market via MLB.TV, since U.S. viewers don’t fall within the Canadian blackout territory.

Nationally televised games (on channels like ESPN, FOX, FS1, and TBS) are available to U.S. fans via live TV providers or streaming services. But MLB.TV doesn’t include those live broadcasts.

How to watch in Canada

In Canada, the Toronto Blue Jays are exclusively broadcast through Sportsnet and its related feeds like Sportsnet One and Sportsnet 360. The network covers nearly every game throughout the regular season and postseason.

For French-speaking fans, TVA Sports (via a sub-licensing arrangement with Sportsnet) carries French-language broadcasts of Blue Jays games and some national MLB content in Canada.

Occasional Friday night Blue Jays games are exclusive to Apple TV+, which aren’t available through Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.

Want radio coverage? The Blue Jays’ flagship radio station is Sportsnet 590 The Fan (CJCL AM 590) in Toronto, with coverage available across southern Ontario. It simulcasts most games and is carried on satellite and digital platforms.

2025 Toronto Blue Jays playoff TV schedule

The Blue Jays finished the regular season as champions of the AL East for the first time since 2015, securing a first-round bye and home-field advantage. The team then defeated the archrival New York Yankees in the Division Series, earning the franchise’s first American League Championship Series appearance since 2016.

Now, they face the Seattle Mariners in a rare ALCS matchup. Below is the full U.S. playoff TV schedule as it’s currently known, with all games will air on Sportsnet in Canada. I’ll keep the table updated as soon as more information comes out.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Blue Jays

Canada: Score a standalone in-market TV package for Blue Jays games

If you’re a local fan in Canada who wants to stream games without a cable package, Sportsnet+ is your best bet. A subscription gives you access to nearly every regular-season Blue Jays game that isn’t nationally televised. Once subscribed, you can watch online or via the Sportsnet app on your preferred device.

Just don’t forget to add Apple TV+ to your setup if you want to catch the exclusive Friday Night Baseball games, which often feature the Blue Jays. That applies to fans in both Canada and the U.S.

United States: Get MLB.TV and a live TV service

For U.S.-based fans looking to watch the Toronto Blue Jays throughout the 2025 season, the most complete and convenient setup is a combination of MLB.TV and a live TV streaming service.

MLB.TV is the best way to watch nearly every Blue Jays game, since they’re considered an out-of-market team in the U.S. This means you can stream all regular-season games live or on demand, with the exception of those that air nationally on channels like ESPN or FOX.

To cover those national broadcasts, services like Fubo, DIRECTV, or Sling TV are your best bets.

  • Fubo: A top choice for sports fans, Fubo offers access to ESPN, FOX, FS1, and more, along with the option to integrate your MLB.TV subscription directly into the platform for a seamless viewing experience.
  • DIRECTV: DIRECTV’s streaming option also offers full access to national channels and supports MLB.TV as an add-on, making it a solid traditional alternative.
  • Sling TV: For a more budget-friendly approach, Sling TV with both the Orange and Blue packages plus the Sports Extra add-on gives you access to ESPN, TBS, FS1, and MLB Network. Keep in mind you’ll need to manage MLB.TV separately.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Blue Jays FAQ

How can I watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free?

To watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free, your best bet is to sign up for a Sportsnet+ free trial in Canada, or a Fubo or DIRECTV free trial in the U.S. for nationally televised games. You can also check MLB.TV’s Free Game of the Day, which occasionally features the Blue Jays at no cost.

How can American viewers watch the Blue Jays most effectively?

In the U.S., the best way to watch the Blue Jays is with MLB.TV, which includes nearly every out-of-market game. Pair it with Apple TV+ for Friday exclusives and a live TV service (like Fubo or Sling TV) for games on ESPN, FOX, FS1, or MLB Network. This combo ensures full-season coverage.

Why should American fans care about the only MLB team north of the border?

The Blue Jays feature a star-studded lineup with names like Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Bo Bichette, plus they’re constant playoff contenders. Their games often feature thrilling matchups against top AL East rivals—and the newly renovated Rogers Centre is one of baseball’s most unique ballparks.

Why you should trust us

As an Ontario resident, lifelong Blue Jays fan, and a Sportsnet subscriber who also has Apple TV+ for the Friday games, I understand firsthand the challenges of navigating MLB broadcast options.

I’ve used that experience to make this guide as helpful and practical as possible for fellow Jays fans.

I created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Toronto Blue Jays fans in mind.

After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Blue Jays’ 2025 season, I determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out CableTV.com’s How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
ABC, FOX, FS1, TBS, ESPN, and ESPN2 are home to MLB postseason games, and we’ve outlined the best TV providers for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin on Tuesday, September 30, and culminate with the 121st edition of the World Series, which starts Friday, October 24. You can watch playoff games on popular baseball channels from ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports, though channel lineups vary across each round.

American League fans should have FOX and FS1 locked and loaded for key matchups. However, National League followers will need access to TNT Sports channels like TBS and truTV, or a subscription to HBO Max, to catch that side of the postseason bracket.

Scroll down to see which TV providers carry these channels and how you can watch some playoff action for free.

Jump to:

  • MLB Playoffs channels
  • MLB Playoffs TV schedule
  • Watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get the most MLB action on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels are the MLB Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLB Playoffs will likely air across six channels, based on last year’s schedule:

  • ABC
  • FOX
  • FS1
  • TBS
  • truTV
  • ESPN
  • ESPN2

Most MLB playoff channels are easy to find from various TV providers, but you may need a higher-tier TV plan to access specific networks. Additionally, ESPN Deportes, Fox Deportes, MLB Network, truTV, UniMás, and Univision will carry Spanish-language postseason coverage.

Pro tip: All games airing on FOX and FS1 will stream on FOX One, while TBS games will stream on HBO Max’s Standard and Premium plans. But it’s important to note that you might not need every playoff channel listed above, especially if you’re only tuning in for a specific team.

MLB Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin in late September, starting with the Wild Card Series. After that, the action moves to the divisional and league series. The 121st World Series begins in late October.

See the first table below to find out when each series starts and which channels you can watch them on. Then, for a more comprehensive look at each series, click on the drop-down menus a little further down. I’ll be updating the schedules as the postseason unfolds.

Best TV plans for watching the MLB Playoffs

Now that you know the channels you’ll need to watch this year’s playoffs, you have a better idea of what to look for when choosing a TV provider. But we’ll make it a step easier. Here’s a list of our three favorite postseason TV plans.

  • Antenna: You can catch every playoff game airing on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, as long as you’re within range of a local affiliate station. Check out our Watch For Free section below for more on this viewing option.
  • Sling TV + Antenna: Sling TV is the most affordable option for watching the MLB Playoffs because its Sling Orange + Blue plan offers FS1, TBS, and ESPN for just $60.99/mo.. While it lacks nationwide coverage for ABC and FOX, you can still stream ABC games through ESPN3 and use an antenna for FOX broadcasts.
  • YouTube TV: At $82.99/mo., YouTube TV is an excellent service for streaming the MLB Postseason. You’ll get every playoff channel and sick features like multiview and unlimited DVR storage. We typically don’t recommend YouTube TV during the MLB regular season because it lacks MLB Network and crucial regional sports networks. But that won’t affect your viewing experience during the playoffs.

Which TV providers offer MLB playoff channels?

Most major TV providers offer the core MLB playoff networks, covering everything from the Wild Card Series to the World Series. Our table below highlights 13 popular providers and whether they carry the necessary channels.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase†)
MLB playoff channels:
ABC and FOX
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Because the MLB Playoffs air across several basic cable networks, you’ll need a TV subscription to access the entire slate of playoff games. Some live TV streaming services offer free trials, but most don’t last longer than seven days.

You can watch a slice of playoff action without subscribing to a TV plan using an OTA antenna on your smart TV. Since ABC and FOX air various playoff games, you can tune in for free through your local network affiliates. That’s especially important since FOX will show the complete World Series.

If you need a high-quality antenna, we suggest checking out the Mohu Leaf 50. It’s one of our favorite antennas because of its 60-mile range and 4K capabilities. Though, you’ll want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool before committing to an antenna. That way, you can ensure ABC and FOX stations are within range of your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs FAQ

What app can I watch the MLB Playoffs on?

If you already have access to MLB playoff channels through a TV provider, you can watch live games through individual channel apps like ESPN, FOX Sports, and TBS. All you need to do is sign in to each app with your TV provider credentials. You can also watch the MLB Playoffs through the MLB app, but you’ll need an eligible TV provider login for live game access.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs without cable?

Without cable, you can watch the entire MLB Playoffs through most live TV streaming services. We recommend Sling TV because it’s the cheapest way to get ESPN, FS1, and TBS in one plan (Sling Orange + Blue at $60.99/mo.), but you’ll likely need an antenna for FOX coverage.

Does Amazon Prime have the MLB Playoffs?

No, a basic Amazon Prime Video subscription doesn’t include nationally televised MLB games like the MLB Playoffs. But you can watch some MLB coverage through Prime Video using add-ons like HBO Max Standard and MLB.TV.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs in Canada?

In Canada, you can watch live MLB Postseason and World Series games on Sportsnet. The most straightforward way to tune in is with a standard Sportsnet+ subscription. You can also catch Candian French–language coverage on RDS and TVA.

What is the new format for the MLB Playoffs?

The current postseason format launched in 2022 when the MLB expanded to a six-team American League and National League playoff bracket. Now, the Wild Card round is a best-of-three series instead of a single-elimination game, and the top two division winners of each league receive byes into the Division Series. Check out the MLB’s Postseason Format Explainer for a closer look at how it all works.

Why you should trust us

Our baseball experts researched the best ways to watch the MLB Playoffs by comparing the most popular TV providers head to head. We based our viewing recommendations primarily on ease of use—focusing on each provider’s channel lineups, pricing, and set-up process.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 World Series
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Don't miss baseball's biggest outing, the World Series, live on FOX and Fox Deportes this fall. Find the best ways to watch the upcoming MLB Fall Classic with our comprehensive viewing guide, highlighting the required channels and top TV providers.

The post How To Watch the 2025 World Series appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free on Fubo

The 2025 World Series will slide into action on Friday, October 24, and air live across FOX and Fox Deportes. Baseball fans can watch the World Series on multiple TV platforms as the National League and American League champions duke it out in a thrilling best-of-seven matchup.

To help you tune in, I’ve put together this complete guide on how to watch the World Series. Keep scrolling for my rundown of the full TV schedule and best TV plans so you never miss a moment of the Fall Classic, no matter if you prefer cable, satellite, or streaming TV.

Jump to:

  • World Series TV schedule
  • Best World Series TV plans
  • Watch the World Series for free

Catch baseball’s finest on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s best TV and internet providers.

What channel is the World Series on?

Every game of the 2025 World Series will air on FOX, with Spanish-language coverage appearing on Fox Deportes. Additionally, for the second consecutive year, Univision will carry its own Game 1 broadcast for Spanish-speaking audiences.

Want radio coverage? You can listen to every World Series game live on ESPN Radio. Team-specific audio commentary will also air on SiriusXM.

2025 World Series TV schedule

While we don’t know which two teams will be competing in the Fall Classic just yet, we do have the official broadcast schedule. As soon as the American League and National League champions are crowned, I’ll update the table below with the specific team matchups.

All World Series games start at 8:08 p.m. ET on FOX, with the MLB on FOX Pregame show beginning at 7:00 p.m. ET. Additional postgame coverage will air on FS1.

*If necessary.

Best TV plans for watching the World Series

The great thing about the World Series airing on FOX is that you have a ton of options for tuning in. But to get the best bang for your buck, I’ve broken down three top options into a simple “Good, Better, Best” format below.

  • Good – Digital Antenna: My first recommendation is also the cheapest. Since FOX is widely accessible as an over-the-air TV station, a simple digital antenna can get you every single World Series game for free without a TV subscription. The antenna itself is a simple, one-time purchase that’ll set you up for the Fall Classic through at least 2028. You’ll just need to be within range of a local FOX affiliate, which you can confirm using the FCC’s Reception Maps.
  • Better – FOX One: If you don’t have a reliable antenna signal, the new FOX One streaming service is your next best option. For $19.99 per month, you get direct feeds of both FOX and Fox Deportes, making FOX One the cheapest and most straightforward way to stream the entire World Series. The service even comes with 24/7 FS1 and FS2 access for additional sports coverage.
  • Best – YouTube TV: If you’re a die-hard sports fan who wants more than just the World Series, a full live TV streaming service like YouTube TV ($82.99/mo.) is the way to go. You’ll get FOX for the big games, plus a complete channel lineup with networks like ESPN, FS1, and TBS for full MLB Postseason coverage.

Which TV providers show the World Series?

While FOX is available across most TV providers, Fox Deportes may require you to subscribe to a higher-tier TV plan. I created the provider table below to illustrate which popular cable, satellite, and live TV streaming services offer the two channels.

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch the World Series for free through your local FOX station, but you’ll first need to connect a digital antenna to your TV.

Many of the best antennas cost anywhere from $20 to $60. But after the one-time payment, you’ll get free access to FOX and several other over-the-air (OTA) channels, depending on your location.

Pro tip: You can verify which OTA channels are within the range of your home by entering your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool or Antenna Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator.

One of my favorite antennas is the Mohu Leaf 50, thanks to its 60-mile range, 4K capabilities, and slim design. But our Best OTA Antennas page highlights several other great options worth checking out.

If you can’t use a digital antenna, the World Series is still accessible by signing up for a free trial through a live TV streaming service. Not all services offer free trials, and most only last seven days—meaning you may have to juggle between two different trials for complete World Series coverage. And, don’t forget to cancel on time.

How to watch the World Series FAQ

How do I stream the World Series?

You can stream the World Series on FOX through FOX One using a standalone subscription or a TV provider login. Live TV streaming services like Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, and YouTube TV also allow you to stream FOX. If you already subscribe to a TV provider that carries FOX, you can also watch the World Series through the FOX Sports app by signing in with your TV provider credentials.

Can I watch the World Series on Amazon Prime Video?

No, live World Series games are not accessible to Amazon Prime Video customers who subscribe to the in-app MLB.TV add-on. But all MLB postseason games are available on MLB.TV 90 minutes after they end.

Does ESPN+ have the World Series?

No, ESPN+ doesn't carry the World Series. While the streaming service hosts select MLB games throughout the regular season, the MLB Playoffs and World Series are not included.

Do you have to pay to watch the World Series?

You don’t have to pay anything to watch the World Series if you already have a TV antenna that picks up your local FOX station. If that’s not your situation, you can still tune in inexpensively by signing up for Fubo’s free seven-day trial. But that won’t last you if the series goes beyond Game 5.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, is an avid baseball fan who follows the World Series every year (even when his beloved Cubbies don’t make it). For this guide, he combined that fan’s perspective with hours of expert research. Taylor compared the prices and channel offerings of the most popular TV services to find the most convenient and cost-effective ways for you to watch the Fall Classic. He chose his TV provider recommendations based on game availability, pricing, and ease of use.

Visit our How We Rank page to learn more about CableTV.com’s ranking methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NBA Cup
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The NBA is bringing back its in-season tournament, the NBA Cup, for another exciting year. From group play to the finals, we’ve got you covered with the best ways to watch all the action live on TV and online.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NBA Cup appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

When I first learned about the NBA’s in-season tournament, I admit I felt extremely skeptical about the whole endeavor. But after seeing the competitiveness of the games, I’m all in, baby. That’s why I created this watch guide to help you watch the NBA Cup.

The league’s in-season tournament is great for fans who like watching good basketball in the opening few weeks of the season. The 2025–2026 iteration gets underway on October 31, and I have all the information for how you can watch every game live.

I’ll get into what services you’ll need and what channels you can watch NBA Cup games on. By the end of this, my goal is that you’ll feel informed and confident about either going with my recommendation, or making my advice your own.

Jump to:

  • NBA Cup channels
  • NBA Cup TV schedule
  • Best NBA Cup TV plans
  • Watch the NBA Cup for free

Get courtside with the best TV plan for NBA coverage

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels show the NBA Cup?

You can watch national coverage of the NBA Cup live on NBC, ESPN, Amazon Prime Video, and Peacock.

Most games will air on regional sports networks (RSNs) during the group stage. So you’ll need your local NBA team’s RSN for in-market games, and an NBA League Pass subscription if you’re out of market.

Pro tip: Head to our How To Watch Local NBA Games guide for a list of every NBA team’s local channel affiliate.

NBA Cup TV schedule

Spanning just over five weeks, the 2025 NBA Cup tips off on October 31 and will end on December 16. The tournament’s group stage will be like any other NBA games, with the exception of the swanky court designs in the home arenas. But the semifinals and final will take place at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas, home of the NHL’s Vegas Golden Knights.

Here’s a snapshot of the tournament’s various rounds and specific game details for the knockout stage. Below you’ll find the entire schedule, which I’ll update as matchups get determined in later stages.

  • Group Play (Oct. 31–Dec. 8)
  • Quarterfinals (Dec. 9–10)
  • Semifinals (Dec. 13)
  • NBA Cup Championship (Dec. 16)

What is the 2025 NBA Cup format?

The NBA Cup’s group play draw took place in July. Using last season’s standings, the league split all 30 NBA teams into groups of five within their conferences. The best teams from each group will move on to the quarterfinals, with two wild cards from each conference joining the pack.

Below is the team list for the six groups in this year’s NBA Cup.

2025 NBA Cup groups

  • East Group A: Cleveland Cavaliers, Indiana Pacers, Atlanta Hawks, Toronto Raptors, and Washington Wizards
  • East Group B: Boston Celtics, Detroit Pistons, Orlando Magic, Brooklyn Nets, and Philadelphia 76ers
  • East Group C: New York Knicks, Milwaukee Bucks, Chicago Bulls, Miami Heat, and Charlotte Hornets
  • West Group A: Oklahoma City Thunder, Minnesota Timberwolves, Sacramento Kings, Phoenix Suns, and Utah Jazz
  • West Group B: Los Angeles Lakers, Los Angeles Clippers, Memphis Grizzlies, Dallas Mavericks, and New Orleans Pelicans
  • West Group C: Houston Rockets, Denver Nuggets, Golden State Warriors, Portland Trail Blazers, and San Antonio Spurs

Did you know? The concept of the NBA Cup draws inspiration from similar international soccer competitions. However, before fully embracing the tournament, the NBA tested the idea with the WNBA Commissioner’s Cup.

Best NBA Cup TV plans

NBA fans who have already prepped for the regular season—even amid the additions of Amazon Prime Video, NBC, and Peacock—will have no trouble watching the NBA Cup. After all, regular-season and in-season tournament games air across the same channels with the same local and national blackout restrictions.

Our How To Watch NBA Games guide offers an in-depth look at the best TV plans for watching pro basketball. But here’s a quick rundown of our favorite NBA-centric TV providers.

  1. Local games: Stream with DIRECTV (starting at $69.99 a month) is the best service for watching in-market NBA games because it has fantastic RSN coverage. It’s expensive, but it also has ESPN and national broadcast channels like ABC and NBC.
  2. Out-of-market games: NBA League Pass is the only way to watch out-of-market NBA games. Some providers offer it as an add-on, but it’s also available as a standalone streaming subscription.

Important
: The NBA Cup knockout rounds all stream on Amazon Prime Video. So even if you don’t have that service for the earlier games, you really can’t go without it once the more exciting part of the schedule hits. And if you’re a cord-cutter, you’ll also need Peacock for the games that air on NBC because you’ll be able to stream those there.

Which TV providers show the NBA Cup?

Most TV providers carry NBA Cup games because ESPN, NBA TV, and TNT are common channels, as highlighted in the table below. But NBA TV may require a higher-tiered plan or add-on package.

Can you watch the NBA Cup for free?

You can watch any NBA Cup games airing on NBC for free using an over-the-air antenna. However, the only other way to watch tournament games for free is by taking advantage of free trial offers from live TV streaming services. Stream with DIRECTV, and Fubo typically provide trial periods of varying lengths.

Amazon Prime Video has a 30-day free trial, which would come in clutch for the last few rounds of the tournament. But no free trial will cover the entire length of the competition.

Stream DIRECTV for Free

How to watch the NBA Cup FAQ

Can you watch the NBA Cup online?

Yes, you can watch the NBA Cup online through any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, ABC, NBC, and your local team’s regional TV affiliate. Out-of-market games are also available to stream via NBA League Pass. Starting in 2025–2026, several games will stream on Peacock and Amazon Prime Video.

Does NBA League Pass have NBA Cup games?

Yes, NBA League Pass shows every live out-of-market game during the NBA Cup’s group stage. Similar to the regular season, games televised locally and nationally are accessible on demand via NBA League Pass after the conclusion of each matchup.

How does the NBA Cup work?

The NBA Cup features group play and knockout rounds. All games contribute to the NBA regular-season standings, except the championship match. As the tournament progresses, the top-performing teams from each group advance to the quarterfinals—vying for the NBA Cup title.

Is the NBA Cup on Amazon Prime?

Yes, several games will stream on Amazon Prime Video during the NBA Cup, including all games in the quarterfinals, semifinal, and final.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, researched and tested the best services for watching this year’s NBA Cup—having watched last season’s tournament. After compiling a list of tournament channels, he compared the network lineups of popular providers. He determined his viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and additional features.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Sacramento Kings: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Ready to Light the Beam? Don’t miss a single Sacramento Kings game. Our guide has the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule, channel listings, and top streaming picks.

The post How To Watch the Sacramento Kings: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Sacramento Kings entered 2025 with big ambitions. They traded longtime point guard De’Aaron Fox to the Spurs in a massive three-team deal, landing Zach LaVine, Sidy Cissoko, and several draft picks. Then, the Kings added veteran guard Dennis Schröder to round out the roster. The hope is that this new-look squad can recapture the glory Sacramento showed in their riveting playoff series against the Warriors a few years back.

They’ll still lean on DeMar DeRozan and Domantas Sabonis to steady the lineup as the roster adapts. With Doug Christie now in the head coaching chair, this is a pivotal season where cohesion, health, and chemistry will make or break their run.

Fans should be on the lookout to see if the new pieces gel with the established core this season. To make sure you don’t miss a thing, keep reading for my complete rundown on how to watch every Kings game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Sacramento Kings channels
  • Sacramento Kings TV schedule
  • Best Sacramento Kings TV plans
  • Watch the Kings for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Sacramento Kings games?

Most Sacramento Kings games air locally on NBC Sports California, the team’s regional broadcast partner. For fans outside the Sacramento area, your go-to service for these games will be NBA League Pass.

A handful of high-profile NBA games will also air nationally on channels like ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. Additionally, select Kings games will stream exclusively on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock.

Want radio coverage? The Sacramento Kings offer live radio coverage through Sactown Sports 1140 AM (KHTK). Fans across Northern California can also tune in through the Sacramento Kings Radio Network, which includes affiliates in cities like Auburn and Redding.

2025–2026 Sacramento Kings TV schedule

Sacramento’s schedule is rich with narrative threads, like De’Aaron Fox returning to Golden 1 Center in a Spurs uniform. That’ll certainly tilt some matchups into personal territory.

Beyond the emotional rematches, other must-see games include Zach LaVine’s debut and his first clash with his former Bulls squad. You’ll also want to circle the high-stakes showdowns against Western Conference elite like the Nuggets and Thunder. With Domantas Sabonis still anchoring the frontcourt, every marquee home game becomes an audition for chemistry.

To help you follow along with all the drama, I’ve laid out the complete 2025–2026 Kings TV schedule below. I’ll be keeping it updated with all the latest start times and broadcast information.

Best TV plans for watching the Sacramento Kings

The NBA’s latest media deal makes watching every Kings game slightly more complex. To simplify things, I’ve broken down my top provider recommendations for every type of Kings fan.

For anyone living in the Northern California market, your top priority is getting NBC Sports California. Typically, I recommend Stream with DIRECTV as the best all-in-one service for NBA and NHL coverage. But you can actually go with YouTube TV as a slightly cheaper option that still delivers NBC Sports California alongside the league’s main national channels. You’ll also get unlimited DVR storage and, my personal favorite, multiview capabilities.

If you’re an out-of-market fan, your most essential subscription will be NBA League Pass. That’ll get you those NBC Sports California broadcasts outside the greater NorCal area.

And don’t forget, you’ll still need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock for their exclusive games. But since the Kings only have a few games on those platforms this season, you can probably wait to subscribe until those specific matchups roll around.

Standalone in-market TV package for Kings games

For local cord-cutters, NBC Sports California is also available to stream directly through Peacock. This is a fantastic option if you don’t want a big, expensive live TV package. For $17.95 per month on top of a base Peacock Premium plan, you’ll get access to almost every regular-season Kings game this campaign. Really, you’ll just miss the few games on ESPN and Prime Video.

What I appreciate most about this setup is the flexibility. You can subscribe on a monthly basis, so you’re not locked into a long-term plan. Plus, the add-on includes in-market San Jose Sharks games, making it a great value for any NorCal sports fan.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Sacramento Kings for free

Catching Kings games without paying full price is possible if you know where to look. Many live TV streaming platforms, such as DIRECTV, Fubo, and YouTube TV, offer free trial periods. These usually last around five days and include access to national broadcasters.

Fans nationwide can also pick up select NBA games on ABC and NBC with a digital antenna. This option is a one-time purchase and works especially well in urban areas with strong over-the-air signals.

Lastly, the NBA app is worth keeping on your device. While live games often require a subscription of some kind, the app occasionally provides free national streams or live radio broadcasts. It’s also just nice to have for catching league highlights and game clips throughout the season.

How to watch the Sacramento Kings FAQ

Do I need cable to watch the Kings on NBC Sports California?

No, you can get NBC Sports California through live TV streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo. Peacock also offers the channel as an add-on subscription. Whichever option you choose, you must reside within the NBC Sports California TV market.

Is NBC Sports California on Peacock?

Yes, you can purchase NBC Sports California access as a direct add-on through Peacock. Just remember that availability varies by location, as standard blackout rules still apply.

How can I watch the Kings if I’m out of market?

You can use NBA League Pass to watch out-of-market regular-season games. But you’ll still need separate access to national broadcasts airing on platforms like Amazon Prime Video and ESPN.

Why are some Sacramento Kings games blacked out?

Kings games are blacked out on services like NBA League Pass due to local and national restrictions. A local blackout occurs when the game airs on your in-market NBA team’s regional channel. Meanwhile, national blackouts happen when a game is exclusive to major networks like ESPN or NBC.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, spent hours reviewing the Sacramento Kings’ 2025–2026 broadcast details to make this comprehensive guide. She reviewed NBC Sports California’s coverage policies, confirmed national TV partners, and cross-checked streaming availability across all viewing options.

Creshonda vetted every piece of information for accuracy, ensuring Kings fans know exactly when and where to watch their team. For more insight into how we evaluate TV providers and streaming options, check out our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch the Golden State Warriors
  • NBA League Pass Review
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: Xfinity vs. AT&T Internet: Comparing Speeds, Pricing, Deals, And More
item.dc:creator: Rachel Oaks
item.description:
When the competition is AT&T Fiber vs. Xfinity Internet, we say AT&T is better than Xfinity. While our recent customer satisfaction survey put AT&T Fiber and Xfinity Internet on equal footing for reliability, you’ll get faster speeds if you go with AT&T Fiber.

The post Xfinity vs. AT&T Internet: Comparing Speeds, Pricing, Deals, And More appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:

Excellent customer satisfaction
Stellar fiber internet speeds
Limited fiber availability

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers available in all areas. See full disclaimer regarding pricing and features for more information.

Is Xfinity or AT&T better?

On most fronts, Xfinity internet and AT&T internet aren’t drastically different. Xfinity’s slower internet speeds are cheaper than AT&T’s slow fiber plans. But AT&T’s high-speed fiber plans are cheaper than Xfinity’s, so you’ll get a lot of bang for your buck with AT&T.

And while both providers have a reasonably sized data cap on some plans, most of AT&T’s plans come with unlimited data. In comparison, Xfinity’s only plan with unlimited data is the superfast, uber-expensive Gigabit Pro.

And when looking at the prices, remember that AT&T includes the price of its Wi-Fi gateway, which most providers charge around $10 a month for. Renting Xfinity’s xFi Gateway will cost you $14 a month, but you can bring your own compatible modem and router instead to avoid ongoing charges.

While our survey of internet customers like you put Xfinity above AT&T in overall satisfaction, both providers offer different plans based on where you live, which makes it hard to pick a clear winner.

Go for AT&T Fiber if you want speed, but consider Xfinity if you’re looking for affordable internet (and you’re willing to buy your own modem and router). Keep on reading to find out more about our takes on each provider. 

Why should you trust us? At CableTV.com, our internet experts have spent thousands of hours testing all of the best (and worst) internet services, and hundreds more hours tracking and researching industry trends.

For this article, we drew from our existing Xfinity and AT&T internet reviews. As part of these reviews, we surveyed hundreds of real Xfinity and AT&T internet customers to see how they felt about their internet service. We also combined this data with our original research and reporting to see which internet provider comes out on top.

Want other options?

There may be other major internet providers in your area, like Spectrum, Frontier, Optimum, or CenturyLink. Enter your zip code below to see your internet choices.

Compare Xfinity or AT&T internet head to head
Customer Rating

Prices starting at
 $40.00/mo.

Max download speeds up to
 2000 Mbps

Service Type
 Cable

View Plansfor Xfinity

Read Xfinity Review
Customer Rating

Prices starting at
 $55.00/mo.

Max download speeds up to
 5,000 Mbps

Service Type
 Fiber

View Plansfor AT&T

Read AT&T Review

Pricing, speed and availability not guaranteed. Subject to change.

Xfinity vs. AT&T: internet plans and prices

If you’re the only person using your internet and you have modest internet needs, you’ll find a lot to like with Xfinity or AT&T. But things can get complicated if you’re getting internet for more than a few people—let’s break down the biggest internet plans for AT&T and Xfinity.

Xfinity internet plans

Package Prices starting at Download speed Data allowance
300 Mbps $40.00/mo. 300 Mbps 1.2 TB
500 Mbps $55.00/mo. 500 Mbps 1.2 TB
1 Gig $70.00/mo. 1,000 Mbps 1.2 TB
1.2 Gig $100.00/mo. 1,200 Mbps 1.2 TB
2 Gig $100.00/mo. 2,000 Mbps 1.2 TB

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers available in all areas. See full disclaimer regarding pricing and features for more information.

Most of Xfinity’s plans are cable internet, ranging from the basic 300 Mbps to the impressive-for-cable 2 Gig (2,000 Mbps). 300 Mbps is the plan to bank on if you want cheap internet—it has enough get-up-and-go to support a small family using the internet at once.

We like the middle plan, 500 Mbps, for the average user, as it offers plenty of speed at the same price as AT&T’s 300 Mbps plan, but 200 Mbps faster.

If you’re running a home business where speed counts, 1 Gig might be a wiser option. Remember that cable (and DSL) internet download speeds don’t mean equal upload speeds: with 1 Gig’s 1,000 Mbps download speeds, you’ll only get about 100 Mbps upload.

AT&T’s fiber plans are a much better deal than Xfinity’s high-speed plans, though, so if you have the option, we’d say save yourself a buck and go with AT&T.

View Xfinity Plans

AT&T internet plans

Package Price Download speed Data allowance
AT&T Internet 100 $60.00/mo. 100 Mbps Unlimited
AT&T Internet 300 $55.00/mo. 300 Mbps Unlimited
AT&T Internet 500 $65.00/mo. 500 Mbps Unlimited
AT&T Internet 1 Gig $55.00/mo.* 1,000 Mbps Unlimited
AT&T Internet 2 Gig $125.00/mo. 2,000 Mbps Unlimited
AT&T Internet 5 Gig $155.00/mo. 5,000 Mbps Unlimited

Data effective as of post date. Not all offers available in all areas. See full disclaimer regarding pricing and features for more information.

Now that AT&T has discontinued its DSL internet plans, the best alternative is AT&T Internet Air, which uses AT&T’s 5G cellular data network to deliver its internet service. At $60.00 per month with speeds of up-to 225Mbps, it’s a solid option for rural area folks.

Fiber offers a more consistent internet experience than cable and DSL, in more ways than one. Fiber internet’s upload speeds mirror its download speeds—which means no more waiting for an hour for the latest episode of your Typography Talk podcast to upload.

Plus, AT&T Fiber comes with no data caps, so you don’t have to worry about going over your monthly data allowance and being slapped with a fine like you would with an Xfinity plan.

Compared to what you get with Xfinity, any of AT&T’s fiber plans offer an excellent deal price-to-speed-wise. If fiber is available in your neighborhood, we say jump on it.

View Plansfor AT&T

Xfinity vs. AT&T: customer satisfaction

As part of CableTV.com’s annual Internet Customer Satisfaction Survey, we talked to more than 8,800 real internet customers across the U.S. to see how they felt about their internet providers.

Xfinity tied for third overall customer satisfaction in this year’s survey, placing it among fiber providers like Google Fiber and Verizon Fios. Cable internet providers haven’t typically performed this highly in our past surveys, so Xfinity’s top-5 ranking is impressive.

  • 81% of Xfinity customers were highly satisfied with their internet speeds.
  • 71% of Xfinity customers felt Xfinity customer service could effectively meet their needs.
  • 65% of Xfinity customers felt that Xfinity’s prices were excellent given the quality of their internet connection.

What do real Xfinity internet customers think about Xfinity?

They were extremely friendly, kind and helpful during the entire process of getting set up. Any time I've had questions they've answered quickly and solved my issues.

Xfinity customer in Michigan

AT&T tied for 7th in overall customer satisfaction in this year’s survey, coming in a few spots behind Xfinity. Despite AT&T’s speedy fiber plans, customers tended to be more satisfied with Xfinity at the end of the day.

  • 67% of AT&T customers felt AT&T customer service could effectively solve their problems.
  • 73% of AT&T customers were completely satisfied with AT&T’s internet speeds and reliability.
  • But just 63% of AT&T customers felt that AT&T was an extremely good deal compared to the competition.

What do real AT&T internet customers think about AT&T?

We switched to AT&T because they had the most dependable coverage in Simi Valley, CA., and my wife depends on internet for work, often having to upload huge data files to servers. Our coverage has been very consistent and I also believe they are currently updating our area to fiber, which will be even better. Overall, I am. very satisfied with AT&T.

AT&T customer in California

How reliable is Xfinity or AT&T internet?

Xfinity AT&T
Latency 18.8 milliseconds 15.3 milliseconds (fiber), 29.3 milliseconds (DSL)
Internet reliability satisfaction rating 77% positive 73% positive
Internet speed satisfaction rating 81% positive 73% positive

Even though Xfinity inched out AT&T in our customer satisfaction survey, AT&T squeaked out above Xfinity in our own internet speed and reliability research.

According to latency data from our partners at HighSpeedInternet.com, AT&T’s average fiber latency ranked seventh overall and landed among providers including Optimum and CenturyLink.

By comparison, Xfinity’s average latency was in line with other cable internet providers like Optimum and Cox. Xfinity’s latency comes in just a few seconds behind AT&T, but that won’t result in a marked speed difference between providers.

Xfinity vs. AT&T customer service around the web: what do other people say?

AT&T actually has Xfinity beat on other industry customer surveys. In the 2024 edition of the American Customer Satisfaction Index, AT&T Fiber beat out Xfinity with an 80% to 67% approval rating. AT&T also beat out Xfinity across J.D. Power’s annual polling in both fiber and wired internet connections.

Is Xfinity or AT&T internet available in your neighborhood?

Xfinity internet is available across 40 states nationwide, so you’ll likely be in an Xfinity area if you’re near a major city. AT&T technically has a nationwide internet footprint, but as with other fiber/5G internet providers, it has some gaps. AT&T’s fiber internet network has been rolled out on a city-by-city basis, so you may not have fiber coverage even if AT&T’s in your town.

Xfinity vs. AT&T: specs and features

Xfinity and AT&T offer vastly different services, and this extends to their internet plans. Let’s break down everything else you’ll need to factor into your decision between AT&T and Xfinity internet.

AT&T offers straightforward installation

Xfinity installation fees

Provider Pro install Self-install
Xfinity $100.00 $15.00

Both Xfinity and AT&T can mail kits to your home for self-installation, which is a cheaper route if you’re looking at a simple setup.

You shouldn’t need a technician to connect to a previously installed internet line since most of what you’ll need is already in place. But Xfinity charges an extra one-time $15 fee for its self-install kit.

AT&T installation fees

Provider Pro install Self-install
AT&T $99.00 Included

If you have no existing internet hookups, on the other hand, you’ll want a professional for that from-scratch installation. The same goes for a new fiber installation, which many homes aren’t equipped for yet. If you don’t know whether your home is set up for fiber, check with your internet service provider.

Thankfully, AT&T doesn’t charge extra for its self-install kit. But you might be on the hook for a little extra compared to Xfinity if you’re unlucky enough to need an installer for your fiber internet and don’t qualify for any free installation deals. Important note: Xfinity offers a 30-day money-back guarantee on internet service service, whereas AT&T allows only a 14-day trial period.

Does Xfinity or AT&T have good internet deals?

Xfinity internet deals

Xfinity generally throws out great deals for new internet customers, as you’ll frequently get benefits like discounted Xfinity Mobile plans and streaming service bundles alongside your internet plan.

Xfinity also offers good discounts for students and qualifying groups like teachers or military vets. Head over our Xfinity deals page for all the details.

AT&T internet deals

AT&T’s similarly generous for new customers, as online enrollees can frequently get service discounts or reward cards when they sign up for an internet plan. Visit AT&T deals page for AT&T’s current deals.

Xfinity and AT&T have a mix of annoying fees

Xfinity fees and extra charges

Fees Amount
Professional installation $100.00
Self-installation $15.00
Modem/router rental $14.00/mo.
Data overage fee $10.00 per 50 GB over 1.2 TB
Reactivation fee $6.00
Late payment fee $10.00
Taxes and surcharges Vary by area

Some of Xfinity’s one-time fees are unavoidable—but you can purchase your own modem/router to use with Xfinity internet, which eventually saves you money compared to renting month to month. Just be prepared to do most of your own troubleshooting.

If you somehow surpass Xfinity’s monthly internet data cap (1.2 TB), you’ll be charged $10 for every 50 GB you go over. How much is a TB (terabyte) of data? To give you an idea, you’d have to stream over 11 hours of Hulu shows every day for a month to hit it.

AT&T internet fees and extra charges

Fees Amount
Professional installation $99.00
Self-installation Included
Modem/router rental Included
Data overage fee $10.00 per 50 GB over 1 TB
Reactivation fee $35.00
Late payment fee $9.99
Taxes and surcharges Vary by area

Unlike Xfinity, AT&T includes the cost of its modem/router combo in your internet plan, so you don’t have to worry about that as a hidden fee.

Except for the lack of equipment fee and the $35 reactivation fee (ouch), AT&T’s extra costs are fairly similar to Xfinity’s. Check the table above for all the details.

But AT&T offers an important equipment freebie

Xfinity equipment

Provider Rental fee
Xfinity
xFi Wireless Gateway
$14.00/mo.

Xfinity and AT&T make their own modem/routers available as an option for new customers, which can be helpful. Both providers offer 24/7 support and regular software updates, but Xfinity’s router comes with a $14 monthly rental fee.

AT&T equipment

Provider Pro install
AT&T
Wi-Fi Gateway
Included

By comparison, AT&T throws in a free router for all customers. Unfortunately, AT&T doesn’t let you bring a third-party modem to your service.

Xfinity’s bundle options offer slightly more value

Xfinity bundle options

Want to save some cash on TV and internet? Bundling your Xfinity services is the way to go—you’ll save $20 per month, based on what the services would cost alone. Xfinity also offers a litany of services like TV, cell phone, landline, and home security coverage. Cord-cutters won’t be left out of the party either thanks to Xfinity’s StreamSaver bundle, which offers Apple TV+, Peacock, and Netflix for a discounted rate.

AT&T bundle options

AT&T no longer offers any TV bundles with DIRECTV or DIRECTV STREAM. You can still purchase a TV plan from DIRECTV while you checkout with your AT&T internet package, but the bills will be separate and there will be no bundling savings.

Find your service

Not sure which internet providers service your part of the country? Enter your zip code, and we’ll help you find all the prominent providers in your area.

Xfinity vs. AT&T FAQ

Is AT&T better than Xfinity?

It’s safe to say AT&T Fiber is better than Xfinity Internet. Compared to Xfinity, AT&T Fiber gives you better download speeds, faster upload speeds, and no data caps.

Is Xfinity Internet any good?

Xfinity Internet isn’t bad—it offers fast download speeds and data caps with plenty of breathing room. Plus, it’s gotten a lot better at customer service over the years. We don’t think it’s quite as good as AT&T Fiber, but it’s not a bad service overall.

What’s the difference between DSL, cable, and fiber internet?

DSL (digital subscriber line) uses telephone wires to send you your internet, while cable internet is delivered through cable TV lines. Fiber uses fiber-optic glass strands to transfer internet data as bursts of light.

How do I find out if Xfinity or AT&T is available in my area?

You can use CableTV.com’s handy availability map to see if Xfinity or AT&T (or another internet provider) services your zip code.

Does Comcast own AT&T?

AT&T is the world’s largest telecommunications company, and Comcast is the second-largest, so nah, Comcast doesn’t own AT&T. Comcast does own Xfinity, though, which is why you may sometimes see it referred to as Xfinity from Comcast.

Why you should trust us

Our experts compared Xfinity and AT&T’s bang for your buck, reliability, features, and customer satisfaction. We compared plans and prices side by side, along with hidden fees and extra perks, to best picture how the two providers stack up. For more information on our methodology, check out our How We Rank page.

Related articles

  • Xfinity Review
  • AT&T Review

Xfinity internet
